column4: Any idea why installation of Xubuntu on a PERC RAID SCSI controller might fail?
(Dell PowerEdge 2500)
I installed 6.06 just fine on a PowerEdge 2550
Okay.  I may fall back to 6.06 then -- perhaps the problem could be with 6.10...?  Any config tricks or oddities?
Nah, i have 1 raid 1 for boot then a raid 5 for data, it saw em as sda and sdb right off
I have 2 scsi backplanes in it, didn't try with just 1
Only "catch" I've got is that I've also got IDE controller in this machine, but I set PERC to be first boot.
Before 6.06 I always had to set up the raid 1 boot as 2 separate ext2 then make a raidtab afterwards and manually make the array

I'm not using RAID at all on this system -- don't need to be that advanced.  :)  Think I may have messed up the partition table on the boot drive during the first install attempt, so I'm going to run through it again and see if that's the fix.  Can't find anything else that would be causing this.
You still around?  Curious about your bios settings and if something may be holding me up here...
Yup i'm here
I put the PERC in SCSI mode and tried again.  Still no go.  I took out the IDE controller completely and I'm trying to install AGAIN.
I get an odd error trying to install grub on this system:  Unknown partition table signature.

I didn't mess much in the bios. I just set up the 2 raid arrays, 1 raid 1 which is the boot and 1 raid 5 which is the data areas. I also did disable the other SCSI controllers which aren't connected to anything. I think i may have had to put a SCSI terminator on the last drive but otherwise pretty much stock config
thanks.  This is becoming a bigger issue than I'd hoped!
this 2550 came with only 1 of the SCSI daughterboards, i put in another one from an old defunct 2450 but it was identical to the one in there
what size are the drives you've got in that beast?  :)(
On the raid 1 matched IBM Ultrastar  10K 16Gb, for the raid 5, 3(+1 spare) matched seagate Cheetah 10K 36Gb
Did you have to do any partition size tricks to get GRUB to load properly?

ope, not on the 6.06 server install, it saw sda as the raid 1. but previously i had to make the partitions raid autodetect types, it was not seeing them as a single unit then, and then do where modify grub for md0 and then mkraid   etc etc
Alrighty then.  thanks again.
np
